summary: The 'IVF for Military Families Act' amends Title 10 of the United States Code to provide fertility treatment, including in vitro fertilization (IVF), under the TRICARE program for active-duty members of the uniformed services and their dependents. It limits IVF oocyte retrievals to three but allows unlimited embryo transfers based on guidelines. The bill defines infertility and fertility-related care, including specific treatments. It mandates the Secretary of Defense to establish a program to coordinate fertility-related care and provide training to community healthcare providers. The amendments will apply to services provided on or after October 1, 2027.
